settings.title: Description
settings.content:
Struggling with cracked, itchy, irritated skin from hand eczema, dermatitis, or sweaty gloves? You’re not alone. Many people suffer in silence, constantly battling gloves that trap sweat, making skin issues worse.

DRYE gloves are different. Developed over seven years with Sweden’s leading research institutions, they actively wick away moisture—keeping your hands truly dry so your skin can heal naturally.

✅ No more sweaty, irritating gloves
✅ Less reliance on expensive creams & ointments
✅ Stay dry and protected—at work, during sports, or overnight

Hairdressers, pro hockey players, mining workers, mechanics, and others rely on DRYE gloves daily to protect their hands and prevent flare-ups.

  • Hairdressers: No more irritation from wet gloves during long shifts
  • Hockey Players & Athletes: Dry hands = better grip & comfort in sweaty gear
  • Mining & Industrial Workers: Relief from gloves that used to trap moisture and worsen skin issues
  • Everyday Consumers: Sleep, work, and live without cracked, painful hands

Most glove liners—made from cotton, silk, or bamboo—become wet and sticky, trapping sweat inside. DRYE gloves break that cycle. Using an innovative stitching technique and sustainable wood cellulose, they create a breathable, hypoallergenic barrier that wicks moisture away instead of absorbing it—keeping your hands dry and comfortable.

✔️ Designed for sensitive skin – No irritating seams or materials
✔️ Durable & long-lasting – 3-12 months lifespan with daily use
✔️ Washable & reusable – A cost-effective, sustainable solution

Imagine waking up without cracked, painful hands. Imagine working without discomfort. That’s what DRYE gloves have done for hundreds of people—and now they can do the same for you.

Get your pair today and experience the difference.

settings.title: How to use
settings.content:
1. Start with Dry Hands
For the best comfort, put on DRYE gloves when your hands are clean and dry—this prevents moisture from getting trapped.

2. Wear Alone or Under Gloves
Use them on their own or as a liner under work, sports, or protective gloves for extra protection and all-day comfort.

3. Make Them Part of Your Routine
Wear daily to reduce flare-ups and keep your hands protected from sweat, dryness, and irritants.

4. Easy to Wash & Reuse
Machine washable up to 90°C. Air dry to keep them soft, fresh, and effective for months.

settings.title: Areas of use
settings.content:
✔️ Anyone with Skin Conditions
Struggling with eczema, psoriasis, atopic dermatitis, or Raynaud's? DRYE gloves help by wicking away moisture, reducing irritation, and keeping your skin dry—so you can focus on life, not discomfort.

✔️ Athletes & Active Professionals
Sweaty hands ruining your grip? Whether you're a hockey player, cross-country skier, or gym enthusiast, DRYE gloves reduce friction, prevent moisture buildup, and help you perform at your best—without the discomfort of sticky gloves.

✔️ Industry Workers & Tough Environments
Long shifts in construction, mechanics, or industrial work mean sweaty, irritated hands. DRYE gloves fit under protective gear, keeping hands dry, comfortable, and shielded from harsh conditions, so you can focus on the job, not the discomfort.

settings.short_description: Advanced Textile Innovation to Keep Moisture, Irritation & Eczema Away

settings.title: Description
settings.content:
Keep your hands dry and comfortable with DRYE gloves – the first gloves that actively wick moisture away from the skin for long-term relief. Developed over seven years in collaboration with Sweden’s top research institutions, these gloves use advanced moisture-wicking technology to help reduce issues like eczema, dermatitis, and Raynaud’s.

Made from sustainable wood cellulose, DRYE gloves create a breathable, hypoallergenic barrier that is gentle on the skin and designed for daily use. Unlike cotton, bamboo, and silk, DRYE gloves offer superior moisture control, making them a better choice for people with skin issues.

Continual use has been shown to reduce the need for costly creams and ointments. Lifespan: 3–12 months.

settings.title: How to use
settings.content:
To get the best results from your DRYE eczema-friendly gloves, follow these simple steps:

1. Start with Clean, Dry Hands: Before wearing your DRYE gloves, ensure your hands are clean and dry. This helps prevent trapped moisture, which could lead to irritation or discomfort. Proper hand hygiene is key to effective skin protection.

2. Wear Under Gloves for Extra Protection: DRYE gloves can be worn under work, sport, or protective gloves for added protection. This extra layer helps shield your skin from dryness and irritants while allowing for comfort and full mobility.

3. Wear Daily for Consistent Relief: For lasting relief from eczema, dry, or cracked skin, wear DRYE gloves daily. Regular use soothes skin, reduces flare-ups, and maintains a protective barrier against environmental triggers. Make them part of your daily routine for the best results.

4. Wash & Reuse for Long-Term Durability: DRYE gloves are machine washable up to 90°C. After washing, air dry to maintain softness and effectiveness. Reuse regularly for continuous support, keeping the gloves fresh, hygienic, and durable

settings.title: Areas of use
settings.content:
DRYE Eczema Gloves are the perfect choice for:

Individuals with Skin Conditions: Alleviate symptoms of eczema, psoriasis, atopic dermatitis, and Raynaud's disease. The moisture-wicking properties help protect against common irritants, creating a dry, comfortable environment for sensitive skin. These gloves provide a superior solution for eczema sufferers, offering better moisture control and skin protection.

Athletes: For those engaging in high-intensity activities, these gloves provide dependable moisture control, reducing friction and maintaining grip. Whether you're a hockey player, cross-country skier, or gym enthusiast, DRYE gloves support optimal performance and comfort, providing a better alternative to nitrile gloves or organic cotton gloves in sports environments.

Industry Workers: Designed to withstand demanding environments, DRYE gloves are compatible with protective gear and can be comfortably worn for extended periods. Ideal for mechanics, construction workers, and those in labor-intensive fields, they keep hands dry and shielded from the rigors of the job, offering greater comfort than other gloves. They provide lasting eczema relief while also being an effective solution for sore hands caused by prolonged exposure to harsh conditions.

settings.heading: The first layer wicks it away.

settings.content: I've had eczema on my hands for a long time, and it's been tough to put on my hockey gloves. These glove liners have improved my experience by reducing friction against my skin. At first, it felt a bit weird, but now I've gotten so used to them that I actually don’t want to play without them anymore. It's just more comfortable with them on.

settings.author: Adam Hemberg

settings.heading: Wake Up to Softer, Healthier Hands

settings.text: Unlike cotton, silk, or bamboo, our fabric removes moisture instead of trapping it.

settings.description1: Lightweight, breathable, and designed for sensitive skin—no more sticky, sweaty discomfort like with cotton, silk, or bamboo gloves.
settings.description2: Forget disposable gloves. Ours last 3-12 months, are washable, and help reduce the need for extra creams and treatments.

settings.title1: Designed for Real Relief, Not Just a Quick Fix
settings.description1: Backed by 7 years of research with top Swedish universities, our gloves provide real, lasting comfort—not just temporary relief.
settings.title2: Wake Up with Comfortable, Less Irritated Hands
settings.description2: No more waking up to sweaty, itchy, or irritated skin. Our moisture-wicking fabric keeps your hands dry and comfortable, supporting healing while you sleep.

settings.heading: How Moisture Triggers Eczema – A Closer Look

settings.text: Many eczema sufferers focus on external irritants like allergens, soaps, and fabrics but overlook moisture buildup as a key trigger. When sweat or trapped moisture lingers on the skin, it breaks down the skin barrier, leading to irritation, itching, and increased bacterial growth—worsening flare-ups.

settings.title: What makes the gloves different?
settings.content: Unlike traditional alternatives, keeps moisture away and wicks moisture away from the skin layer—regardless of how long you work, train, or sleep. This new textile technology and glove have shown promising results in Sweden for individuals suffering from hand eczema, cracking, redness, and dry skin.

settings.title: Does this fall under PPE Regulation?
settings.content:
To CE mark a product according to the PPE Regulation, it can only be done if the product meets the requirements for Personal Protective Equipment (PPE), and an inner glove does not qualify as personal protective equipment.

To be considered PPE, the product must protect against external risks to varying degrees, which an inner glove does not do.

This formulation comes from RISE itself.

settings.title: How long does these gloves last?
settings.content: With proper care, the liner is designed to last between 3 to 12 months, although actual durability may vary depending on usage and handling.

settings.title: Why is this liner more expensive than traditional ones?
settings.content: The gloves are priced higher than traditional alternatives because they use advanced anti-sweat technology to keep moisture away from the skin for extended periods. This is important, as moisture can aggravate skin issues like dryness, redness, irritation, and cracks. Traditional liners tend to absorb moisture, leading to wet gloves that can worsen skin conditions. These gloves are washable and reusable, lasting 3 to 12 months.

settings.title: What are the washing instructions?
settings.content: Machine wash the liner at up to 90 degrees. For a fresh feel, some users prefer to hand wash them every few days to maintain their condition.

settings.title: Are these gloves only for people with hand eczema?
settings.content: No, these gloves are not exclusively for individuals with hand eczema. They offer sweat and irritation protection for all users and can be comfortably worn under various glove types, including leather, work, surgical, rubber, household, and disposable gloves. This versatility makes them suitable for a wide range of activities and preferences.
